title: Fairly heavy showers in parts of the island today
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Galle and Matara districts today (16).

title: Environmental concerns mount after fuel bowser accident in Kotmale
byline: Approximately 13,000 litres of diesel and petrol were discharged following a bowser accident on Tuesday (14) along the Nuwara Eliya–Kirimetiya road, raising serious environmental concerns after fuel leaked into key water sources and the Upper Kotmale Reservoir.

title: Opposition party secretaries to meet Sajith for talks on LG bodies
byline: The Secretaries of several opposition parties have agreed to hold discussions with Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa regarding the forming of administrations in local government bodies, following a meeting held in Colombo on Wednesday night (15).

title: Six Sri Lankans held for attempting illegal re-entry from India
byline: Six Sri Lankan nationals have been arrested by police in the Valvettithurai sea area off Jaffna over an attempt to illegally re-enter Sri Lanka from India.

title: Rooftop solar capacity surpasses 1,700 MW in Sri Lanka
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) says it has achieved a major renewable energy milestone, reaching 1,700 MW of installed rooftop solar capacity across the country.

title: Two arrested for attempting to smuggle gold worth Rs. 210M at BIA
byline: Two passengers have been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake for attempting to smuggle gold valued at Rs. 210 million.

title: Two injured as cab transporting avocados overturns in Hatton
byline: A double cab transporting a consignment of avocados veered off the road and overturned into a tea estate located approximately 50 feet below the Hatton-Colombo main road early this morning (May 16).

title: Trump and Abu Dhabi ink partnership to build massive AI data center complex in UAE
byline: The United States and United Arab Emirates will partner to build a massive data center complex in Abu Dhabi to advance artificial intelligence capabilities with 5-gigawatts of capacity — enough to power a major city.

title: ‘Creating safe workplaces for women is critically important’ – PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that significant attention must be drawn to the safety of women in employment, and a secure environment should be created for them in the workplace.
